content: Important question about security of Zulip platform
I read your Privacy Policy (https://zulipchat.com/privacy/) and in section "information we share -> for legal reasons":

We will share personal information with companies, organizations or individuals outside of Kandra Labs if we, in our sole discretion, determine that that access, use, preservation or disclosure of the information is necessary to:

meet any applicable law, regulation, legal process or enforceable governmental request.

enforce applicable Terms of Service, including investigation of potential violations.

detect, prevent, or otherwise address fraud, security or technical issues.

protect against harm to the rights, property or safety of Kandra Labs, our users or the public as required or permitted by law.
This policys apply to your public services only, which you offers to public or they are somehow related even to private installations of zulip?
Im asking becose I just found out that behind Zulip is entity Kandra Labs which is located in 112 S Park St, San Francisco CA 94107
so I have a little security concerns because behind this project is entity from US
so let me ask you... is local installation of Zulip fully private and secure? Is there any communication or "home calls" functions which could jeopardize my privacy?
Are you able to remote access my private installation or any way collect any data from this private installation?

@sfadgfasdgsfsdag self-hosted installations of the Zulip server only interact with Kandra Labs services via
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/mobile-push-notifications.html, which you can choose to sign up for or not (and there's a few options explained there).

The mobile and desktop apps also have some basic interaction with services we control (auto-update to new versions which is important for security, error reporting which is important for our fixing bugs).
but can you remotely access my private installation and get to the private data as stream history, communications and etc.

Im asking because I know that there is laws in USA which forces sw companies to make backdoors in their products which allow company or third subject to access data in their product and there is no way around it if you in that jurisdiction...but maybe I just dont understand implication of those local laws...thats why I asking

sfadgfasdgsfsdag said:

but can you remotely access my private installation and get to the private data as stream history, communications and etc.

no.
That's one the big advantages of self-hosting -- you get to choose the jurisdiction where your data is held.
If you were company from switzerland for example, I wouldnt ask this qustions...

I'll add that the fact that Zulip is open source would make it more difficult for us to conceal that sort of bad behavior in a Zulip server release than it would be for a proprietary or Open Core software vendor. But in any case I'd rather shut down Zulip than start shipping backdoored releases.

BTW, I'm going to move this thread to a new topic, please start new conversations using a new topic.

Tim Abbott said:

I'll add that the fact that Zulip is open source would make it more difficult for us to conceal that sort of bad behavior in a Zulip server release than it would be for a proprietary or Open Core software vendor.

Thats true, but theres lot of people which add or modify code in Zulip and even you cannot read every line of code, well Im just stating obvious.

case in point with latest rocket.chat security debacle...there were also lot of devs working ot that project...somebody add code which without administrators consent connected private installation to their services... not that big security bug or hole, but good for example

even you cannot read every line of code

Actually, I do, in the server :smile:
Do you have a link to that rocket.chat issue?
sure
https://forums.rocket.chat/t/enforcing-registration-requirement-to-utilize-push-gateway/7545/83
https://forums.rocket.chat/t/update-on-registration-requirement-to-utilize-push-gateway/7733
they manage to piss lot of users with this stupidity
you can possibly expect influx of some of those pissed ones which are already searching for replacement
their will either run to you or skip this free slack alternative trio mattermost, rocket.chat, zulip and run directli to matrix platform
